Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay, lets start by understanding the task I need to create a BPMN like textual model based on these interview transcripts The key elements are activities, sequence flow, gateways, roles, artifacts, and exceptions

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, Ill identify all the tasks mentioned across interviews Mary starts with receiving an invoice, checking PO numbers, logging into the system, forwarding to purchasing, matching line items, sending for approval, scheduling payment Dan talks about verifying PO details, confirming receipts, sometimes contacting suppliers or AP Carlos mentions approving after review Rita handles exceptions and escalations Karen helps resolve supplier issues

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next, sequence flow receiving invoice  check PO  log in system  forward to purchasing  confirm receipt  match line items  manager approval  payment scheduling But there are decision points if theres no PO, discrepancies, or need for escalation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Gateways would be at checking PO if not valid, send back, after confirmation discrepancies escalate, and after matching approval Roles include AP Clerk, Purchasing Officer, Department Manager, Supervisor, Supplier Manager Artifacts are invoices, purchase orders, emails, corrected versions Exceptions include missing POs, discrepancies needing clarification or escalation, informal services without PO

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I need to structure this into a clear textual model, noting uncertainties and exceptions Make sure the flow is logical even if some steps might vary based on different accounts
